training_organizations.name: Louisiana DCFS Staff Development
training_organizations.description: The Louisiana Department of Children & Family Services runs a staff development unit to train child welfare employees. New caseworkers attend the Child Welfare Training Institute, which covers Louisiana’s policies, investigation techniques, legal protocol (Children’s Code), and case management. Continuing education is offered to keep staff updated on best practices and policy changes.

training_organizations.name: Louisiana CASA Association
training_organizations.description: A statewide nonprofit that supports Court Appointed Special Advocate programs across Louisiana. Local CASA programs recruit and train volunteers who are appointed by judges to advocate for children in abuse/neglect cases. The state CASA Association provides standards, training resources, and advocacy to ensure CASA volunteers effectively represent children’s best interests in court.

refugee_assistance.recipient_name: CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF THE DIOCESE OF BATON ROUGE, INC

policies.TribalFoster: No, Tribes within state do not provide foster care
policies.ReportAnonymous: General public (not mandated reporters) can remain anonymous
policies.FatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews are required for all or some cases
policies.Def_Subtype_Abuse: Physical abuse includes female genital mutilation, punishment, factitious disorder by proxy, shaken baby syndrome, and coerced abortion; Sexual abuse includes sexual trafficking
policies.Def_Subtype_Neglect: Neglect includes abandonment, prenatal exposure to drugs/alcohol, inadequate clothing, medical neglect, lack of shelter, parental substance use, illegal substance use, failure to thrive, inability to meet parent responsibilities (i.e. lack of adequate supervision), and malnutrition.
policies.NearFatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews are required for all or some cases
policies.InvestReq_OtherSpecify: Pictures of injuries and/or environment at the case worker's discretion
policies.ScreenReq_OtherSpecify: Extent and circumstances (threats of danger); Child functioning and vulnerability; Adult functioning/parenting practices (caretaker protective capacities)
policies.ScreenInfo_OtherSpecify: Any immediate safety concern; The reporter's reason to believe the child was abused or neglected; Threats to child's safety
policies.NearFatalities_OtherSpecify: Injuries thought or alleged to be of a suspicious origin
policies.InvestQual_ExperienceSpecify: Six years of full-time work experience in any field may be substituted for the required bachelor's degree OR candidates without a bachelor's degree may combine work experience and college credit to substitute for the bachelor's degree
policies.InvestReq_OtherCases_Specify: Child fatalities; Substance-exposed infants; Physical abuse; Sexual abuse; Neglect
policies.FatalitiesDefine_OtherSpecify: Deaths thought or alleged to be of a suspicious origin
policies.InvestReq_MHEvalCases_Specify: Emotional maltreatment; Cases where this approach might be helpful to elicit information; Cases where the psychological condition of the child/parent could potentially cause further harm to the child
policies.CaseManagerQual_ExperienceSpec: Six years of full-time work experience in any field may be substituted for the required bachelor's degree OR candidates without a bachelor's degree may combine work experience and college credit to substitute for the bachelor's degree
policies.InvestReq_MedEvalCases_Specify: Physical abuse; Any case may require medical evaluation, including cases with an allegation of inadequate food, and cases with possible internal injuries
policies.ScreenerQual_ExperienceSpecify: Six years of full-time work experience in any field may be substituted for the required bachelor's degree OR candidates without a bachelor's degree may combine work experience and college credit to substitute for the bachelor's degree

data.title: CHILDREN/DCFS: Reorganizes the Department of Children and Family Services (EN NO IMPACT   See Note)
data.status: Signed by the Governor. Becomes Act No. 477.

data.title: APPROPRIATIONS: Provides for the ordinary operating expenses of state government for Fiscal Year 2025-2026
data.status: Signed by the Governor. Becomes Act No. 1.

data.title: CHILDREN: Creates a task force to study and report on strategies to increase engagement of fathers in the lives of their children.
data.status: Enrolled.  Signed by the President of the Senate.

data.title: CHILDREN: Requests the Division of Administration's Office of Technology Services to convene a working group that includes every state agency with responsibility for child safety, welfare, and protection.
data.status: Enrolled.  Signed by the President of the Senate and sent to the Secretary of State by the Secretary of the Senate on 6/5/2025.

data.title: MEDICAID: Urges and requests the La. Dept. of Health to increase Medicaid coverage for healthcare services required by individuals with gestational diabetes mellitus
data.status: Taken by the Clerk of the House and presented to the Secretary of State in accordance with the Rules of the House.

data.title: CHILDREN: Provides relative to child welfare. (See Act) (EN INCREASE GF EX See Note)
data.status: Signed by the Governor. Becomes Act No. 409.

data.title: CHILDREN/DCFS: Directs the Partners in Protecting Children Subcommittee of the Children's Cabinet Advisory Board to study the needs of the child welfare system in this state
data.status: Taken by the Clerk of the House and presented to the Secretary of State in accordance with the Rules of the House.

data.title: HEALTH: Requests the Department of Children and Family Services to study the feasibility of implementing a 233 helpline as an additional resource for sexual abuse victims in this state
data.status: Taken by the Clerk of the House and presented to the Secretary of State in accordance with the Rules of the House.

data.title: MEDICAID: Creates a task force to study the potential expansion of behavioral healthcare providers eligible for enhanced Medicaid reimbursement
data.status: Taken by the Clerk of the House and presented to the Secretary of State in accordance with the Rules of the House.

data.title: HEALTH/WOMEN'S: Creates the Postpartum Newborn Nurse Home Visiting Task Force
data.status: Taken by the Clerk of the House and presented to the Secretary of State in accordance with the Rules of the House.

data.title: HEALTH DEPARTMENT: Provides for parish overdose fatality review panels. (8/1/24) (EN SEE FISC NOTE LF EX)
data.status: Signed by the Governor. Becomes Act No. 498.

data.title: FAMILY LAW: Provides for the Uniform Collaborative Family Law Act. (8/1/24)
data.status: Signed by the Governor. Becomes Act No. 98.

data.title: CHILDREN'S CODE: Provides that part of the Children's Code's purpose is to promote public safety. (8/1/24)
data.status: Signed by the Governor. Becomes Act No. 93.

data.title: COURTS: Urges and requests the Louisiana Supreme Court to study the family court for the parish of East Baton Rouge.
data.status: Enrolled.  Signed by the President of the Senate and sent to the Secretary of State by the Secretary of the Senate on 5/24/2024.

data.title: HEALTH: Directs the Louisiana Department of Health to provide statistical information regarding women's health
data.status: Read by title, roll called, yeas 39, nays 52. The resolution was rejected.

data.title: STUDENT/DISCIPLINE: Requests that the state Department of Education review school districts' use of corporal punishment, willful disobedience, and zero tolerance policies and identify best practices for child welfare and attendance personnel
data.status: Read by title, under the rules, referred to the Committee on Education.

data.title: HEALTH/CHILDREN: Provides relative to a minor's consent for medical procedures
data.status: Becomes HB 975.

data.title: CHILDREN/CARE: Provides relative to procedures for reporting child abuse
data.status: Called from the calendar.

data.title: CHILDREN/ADOPTION: Provides relative to adoptive placement
data.status: Read by title, under the rules, referred to the Committee on Civil Law and Procedure.

data.title: WELFARE: Provides relative to program integrity in the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program. (gov sig) (OR +$179,920  EX See Note)
data.status: Introduced in the Senate; read by title.  Rules suspended.  Read second time and referred to the Committee on Health and Welfare.
